intro: Oncoba spinosa var. angolensis, commonly known as the Angola spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Angola and Namibia, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Oncoba spinosa var. angolensis is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
